abstract: Legislative and legal efforts to reduce the swipe fees levied on credit cards and ease the burden on merchants are under siege from financial interests, an economist writes.
snippet: Legislative and legal efforts to reduce the swipe fees levied on credit cards and ease the burden on merchants are under siege from financial interests, an economist writes.
lead_paragraph: Nancy Folbre is an economics professor at the University of Massachusetts, Amherst. She recently edited and contributed to “For Love and Money: Care Provision in the United States.”

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
